lines.content: >  "Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them." - David Allen
Meet **Waz**, a friendly text-based chatbot that helps you managed your tasks with ease.
It's simple, fast and ~~stressful~~ STRESS-FREE to use!
- Add events with date and time
- Add deadlines with date and time ‚è∞
- Mark and unmark tasks as done ‚úÖ

4. Let Waz remember things for you üòâ

* Represents a command to add {@link Deadline} task to the task list
*     When executed, this command validates the input description, start time and end time. Creates a new Deadline task
*     and adds it to the {@link TaskList}, updates the Ui, save the updated list to storage.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the given task description, deadline
* @param argument the description of the Deadline task
* Executes the command by creating a Deadline task and adding it to the task list.
*     The method also updates the Ui to show the newly added task and persists the updated list to the storage file
* @param ui the Ui to show feedback to the user
* @param storage the storage to save the updated task list
* @throws WazException if the description, /by parts are missing or empty
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException {
if (parts[0].trim().isEmpty()) { // Check if description is empty
throw new WazException("A deadline task needs a description!");
} else if (parts.length < 2 || parts[1].trim().isEmpty()) { // Check if /by is missing or deadline is empty
throw new WazException("A deadline task needs a deadline!");
Task deadline = new Deadline(parts[0].trim(), parts[1].trim()); // task name, deadline by...
* Represents a command to add {@link Event} task to the task list

* @param storage the storage to save the updated task list
* @throws WazException if the description, /from, /to parts are missing or empty

throw new WazException("A event task needs a description!");

* Represents an abstract command that can be executed on the task list
*     Each concrete command should implement the {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)} method to define its
* Constructs a Command with the given argument
* @param argument the argument string for the command
* Executes the command with access to the task list, Ui, storage
* @param ui the Ui to interact with the user
* @param storage the storage to persist changes
* @throws WazException if the command encounters an error such as invalid input
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException;
* Indicates whether executing this command should terminate the application
*     By default, commands do not exit. Only ExitCommand will override it to true
* @return true if this command signals program to exit, false otherwise

*     save the updated task list to storage

* @param storage the storage to save the updated task list
* @throws WazException if the number is not a digit or index is out of range
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException {
throw new WazException("OOPS! Please provide a valid task number.");
throw new WazException("OOPS! That task number doesn't exist");

* Represents a command that displays all tasks in the task list

* Represents a command that marks a task as done
* This command takes an index argument referring to the task in the task list,
* and updates the task's status to "not done". It also updates the storage
* and prints a confirmation message via the {@link Ui} class.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the given argument
* @param argument the index of the task to be unmarked, as a string
* Executes the command to mark a task in the task list
* @param ui the Ui to display messages
* @param storage the storage for saving tasks
* @throws WazException if the index is invalid or out of range
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException {
throw new WazException("OOPS! Please provide a valid task number.");
throw new WazException("OOPS! That task number doesn't exist");

* @param input the raw string entered by the user
* @return the appropriate {@code Command} object based on the user input
* @throws WazException if the input does not match any valid command

* The {@code Storage} class handles reading and writing the task data to a persistent file.
* Constructs a Storage instance with the given filename
* @param fileName the name of the file to read/write tasks
* Read the content of the file line by line and convert each line into a {@link Task} object
* Corrupted lines will be skipped with a warning printed.
* If file does not exist, an empty task list is returned.
* @return a {@link TaskList} containing all valid tasks read from the file
// if file is empty return empty list for now
// Read the file line by line
Task task = lineToTask(line); // Convert each line into a waz.task.Task object
* Converts a line from the file into a waz.task.Task Object
* For {@link Event} tasks, if the "/from" field does not contain "am" or "pm", it will be automatically appended.
* @param line a single line from the file
* @return the corresponding w{@link Task} object (Todo, Deadline, or Event)
* @throws WazException if the line is corrupted or any unknown task type
private Task lineToTask(String line) throws WazException {
throw new WazException("Line is corrupted. Failed to create task.");
throw new WazException("Line is corrupted. Failed to create deadline task.");
throw new WazException("Line is corrupted. Failed to create event task.");
throw new WazException("Line is corrupted. Failed to create event task expected from-to.");
throw new WazException("Line is corrupted. Unknown task type.");
